title: Players
text:
`{r} library(dplyr) library(reactable) library(readr)
players <- read_csv(“data/derived/player_summary.csv”, show_col_types = FALSE)
reactable( players %>% arrange(desc(runs_scored_total)), searchable = TRUE, filterable = TRUE, pagination = TRUE, defaultPageSize = 25, columns = list( player = colDef(name = “Player”), runs_scored_total = colDef(name = “Runs”, format = colFormat(digits = 0)), strike_rate_total = colDef(name = “SR”, format = colFormat(digits = 1)), average_total = colDef(name = “Avg”, format = colFormat(digits = 1)), wickets_total = colDef(name = “Wkts”, format = colFormat(digits = 0)), economy_total = colDef(name = “Econ”, format = colFormat(digits = 2)) ) ) `
Upgrade idea: wrap the player column with htmltools::tags() to point to /player/.html once you�re ready to generate individual pages.

title: Leagues
text:
`{r} library(dplyr) library(readr)
player_league <- read_csv(“data/derived/player_by_league_season.csv”, show_col_types = FALSE)
league_summary <- player_league %>% group_by(league, season) %>% summarise( players = n_distinct(player), runs = sum(runs_scored, na.rm = TRUE), wickets = sum(wickets, na.rm = TRUE), .groups = “drop” )
league_summary `
Add charts/tables here once you decide the exact comparisons you want.

title: T20 Analytics
text:
Welcome to T20 Analytics, a lightweight site generated from the data pipeline in this repo.

Use the Players page for sortable leaderboards and to click through to player spotlights.
The Leagues page will house summaries and coverage by competition.
Player-specific dashboards live in player/ and pull from the CSVs in data/derived/.

To rebuild the numbers, run your R script (3-02-2026/R Package.R) so it refreshes data/derived, then run quarto render here.

title: Player
text:
library(dplyr)

Warning: package 'dplyr' was built under R version 4.4.2



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

library(readr)

Warning: package 'readr' was built under R version 4.4.2

library(plotly)

Warning: package 'plotly' was built under R version 4.4.3


Loading required package: ggplot2


Warning: package 'ggplot2' was built under R version 4.4.2



Attaching package: 'plotly'


The following object is masked from 'package:ggplot2':

    last_plot


The following object is masked from 'package:stats':

    filter


The following object is masked from 'package:graphics':

    layout

player_name <- params$player_name

summary <- read_csv("data/derived/player_summary.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
  filter(player == player_name)

by_ls <- read_csv("data/derived/player_by_league_season.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
  filter(player == player_name)

bat_phase <- read_csv("data/derived/player_phase_batting.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
  filter(player == player_name, league == "ALL", season == "ALL")

bowl_phase <- read_csv("data/derived/player_phase_bowling.csv", show_col_types = FALSE) %>%
  filter(player == player_name, league == "ALL", season == "ALL")

summary

# A tibble: 0 × 22
# ℹ 22 variables: player <chr>, leagues_covered <dbl>, seasons_covered <dbl>,
#   matches_played_total <dbl>, balls_faced_total <dbl>,
#   runs_scored_total <dbl>, dismissals_total <dbl>, strike_rate_total <dbl>,
#   average_total <dbl>, boundaries_4s_total <dbl>, boundaries_6s_total <dbl>,
#   fifties_total <dbl>, hundreds_total <dbl>, matches_bowled_total <dbl>,
#   balls_bowled_total <dbl>, runs_conceded_total <dbl>, wickets_total <dbl>,
#   economy_total <dbl>, bowling_average_total <dbl>, …

plot_ly(bat_phase, x = ~phase, y = ~strike_rate, type = "bar", name = "Batting SR")




plot_ly(bowl_phase, x = ~phase, y = ~economy_rate, type = "bar", name = "Bowling Econ")
